sat0.goal: Contribute its instruments to achieve the global imaging and pointing goals as coordinated by the orchestrator.

sat1.goal: Contribute its instruments to achieve the global imaging and pointing goals as coordinated by the orchestrator.

sat2.goal: Contribute its instruments to achieve the global imaging and pointing goals as coordinated by the orchestrator.

sat3.goal: Contribute its instruments to achieve the global imaging and pointing goals as coordinated by the orchestrator.

sat4.goal: Contribute its instruments to achieve the global imaging and pointing goals as coordinated by the orchestrator.

sat5.goal: Must finish pointed to Planet6 and contribute instruments to imaging goals as coordinated by the orchestrator.

sat6.goal: Contribute its instruments to achieve the global imaging and pointing goals as coordinated by the orchestrator.

sat7.goal: Must finish pointed to Star3 and contribute instruments to imaging goals as coordinated by the orchestrator.

sat8.goal: Must finish pointed to Star15 and contribute instruments to imaging goals as coordinated by the orchestrator.

sat9.goal: Contribute its instruments to achieve the global imaging and pointing goals as coordinated by the orchestrator.

orchestrator.goal: Generate a PDDL domain and problem that coordinates the satellites to achieve all specified image goals and final pointing constraints, respecting per-satellite instrument, power, calibration, and pointing constraints. Also confirm which satellite should be assigned to point to Star16 (Star16 assignment is currently unspecified).

final_pointing_constraints.note: Please confirm which satellite must end up pointing at Star16. This assignment is currently unspecified.

public_information: Each instrument is fixed to a host satellite.
Only one instrument per satellite may be powered on at a time (power_available boolean).
Switching an instrument on consumes the host satellite's power and clears that instrument's calibration.
Switching an instrument off frees the host satellite's power.
Calibration requires the host satellite to be pointing at the instrument's calibration target and the instrument to be on; calibration persists until the instrument is switched on again.
Taking an image requires the satellite to be pointing at the target direction, the instrument to be on and calibrated, and the instrument to support the requested mode.
Slew changes a satellite's pointing from one direction to another.

orchestrator.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent STRIPS-style PDDL planning for satellite observation. You will be provided with the complete environment specification (objects, initial state, instrument capabilities, and goals) and the private constraints of each satellite. Produce a PDDL domain and problem encoding that models satellites, instruments, modes, directions, slew, switch-on/off, calibrate, and take-image actions, and captures the power and calibration semantics described. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions and predicates clear and unambiguous, and ensure actions are associated with the correct agent when relevant.
orchestrator.prompt:
Your name is orchestrator.
Initial information about the environment: {environment->init}.
Goal for the environment: {environment->goal}.
The public information is: {environment->public_information}.
Per-satellite private constraints and initial states:
 sat0: {agents->agent_details->sat0->private_information}.
 sat1: {agents->agent_details->sat1->private_information}.
 sat2: {agents->agent_details->sat2->private_information}.
 sat3: {agents->agent_details->sat3->private_information}.
 sat4: {agents->agent_details->sat4->private_information}.
 sat5: {agents->agent_details->sat5->private_information}.
 sat6: {agents->agent_details->sat6->private_information}.
 sat7: {agents->agent_details->sat7->private_information}.
 sat8: {agents->agent_details->sat8->private_information}.
 sat9: {agents->agent_details->sat9->private_information}.
Constraints to respect: one powered instrument per satellite, switching on clears calibration, calibration requires pointing at calibration target with instrument on, taking images requires pointing, on, calibrated, and support for mode. Do not make assumptions beyond the given information. Note: the final pointing requirement for Star16 is currently unassigned to a specific satellite; confirm the intended satellite or leave as an explicit unassigned requirement in the PDDL problem if necessary. Provide only the PDDL domain and problem files as specified.
